title: Connection Failure: Unable to connect to the PVP.net server. - Patch 5.9
body:
I've never had this problem before Today. After the client had finished updating, it wouldn't allow me to connect to the PVP.net. The login itself works, as it states it's logging in but then just comes up with this message. 

**_Connection Failure: Unable to connect to the PVP.net server.
Information regarding what may have caused this error can be found here.
Service availability can be viewed on the League of Legends Server Status web page._**

I've had the game installed on this computer for about 10 months now and this is the first problem to ever occur during this period. 
I've tried countless things to get it to fix, such as refreshing the DNS server over the CMD command prompt. 
I tried looking through the suggestions on the riot Support and Help section that it links me to. 
As well as changing the DNS server address through control panel.
And yet nothing seems to work for me. Any ideas on how to fix this problem?

replies.body:
I've seen a few threads about this problem. Some are a few months old; as old as patch 5.2

I have the same issue, on my 9th attempt at loggin, I finally got in. That's just today. I've had this for 4 weeks now.

Hundreds of posts and comments on this from players. 

Has Riot posted ANYTHING on this? Are they addressing it? Has it been stated that this is a problem they are working on?
Aaaaaaaaaaand 5.10 is out, and still no fix.

I've had this happen for a week or so now and nothing else has changed on my computer.  I've never bothered to go and find the event log if there is one for connections in the game folder but I may need to look into it further as everyone else I play with lately sees the same issue but the second time we choose to connect it lets us in...  Why is debugging and fixing this particular issue so difficult?  I can package up some of my install files for RIOT to review and maybe then we can all see a fix?!

The struggle doesn't appear to be over yet; in another thread I saw that a Riot Superfoxman said, "We identified and issue that was preventing players from logging in and resolved it about an hour ago. We will keep monitoring for anything else that could be impacting players." Unfortunately, that was over three months ago, and this issue doesn't appear to have been resolved yet. 

After maybe...six or so login attempts, I finally made it in to play some games with my friend, but subsequent login attempts have been thwarted by the 'unable to connect to the server at pvp.net' message.

I tried uninstalling and reinstalling today, as well as disabling my recently added antivirus, but neither of these things seem to have any impact on my chances of logging in. 

I really do hope a fix comes out for this as soon as possible. glhf, everyone.

[here is a link to the thread with[ Superfoxman's response](http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/help-support/u299Txjw-connection-failure-unable-to-connect-to-the-pvpnet-server-issue-since-patch-52)]

This has been happening to me as well. I have been trying to login for the past 3 days. I have tried everything you have, as well as restarting my computer, disabling my firewall, and turning off my Internet Protocol Version 6. (LoL cannot run on IPV6, only IPV4). It is making me mad and I don't know what to do. I hope Riot addresses this issue very soon...
Can't log-in either, just putting in my two cents.

For the moment, since a lot of people are actually unable to log in, I would suggest you don't try anything further and wait a bit. If you find that everyone else is connecting but you are still not able to, then let me know and we'll go further.

Edit: I do find it a bit sus that only NA players are keeping this discussion active.
